title: Person of Interest 2x21 Finch talks about the Machine
author: George Finch
comment: One of the most beautiful scenes of the show. The guilt and defiance in Finch, the sheer heartbreak in Root. Brilliantly acted and written.

Root was so disliked at first....then she turned out I was rooting (intended) for her to stay on the show as long as possible.  She was an awesome character and incredible actress.  And not enough can be said for Michael Emerson. Will watch any show with either of them in it.  But the Characters on this show were outstanding.  And SHAW,  she couldn't be over 5'3" and badass Character right there.  Reese, Carter and Fusco.  If I won the lottery, I'd get all those people back together.  Sad when it ended for sure.
one of the best scenes of the whole Series
"1.618 seconds later"... 1.618, the golden ratio, phi.

Bench should have taken the time to realize that if it was starting to act like a person that he could have molded it and shaped it into a righteous protective "person" that uses it's capabilities for the good of humanity; that could detect and notice when the Intel is being used in an abusive destructive manner and put a stop to it and expose the individual that is using the numbers it reveals for evil purposes if he hadn't done that I'm pretty sure he anrijs when you get a lot more effective in protecting people and possibly could have prevented detective Carter from being killed for the machine would have been the good guy A.I. version of Eagle eye and putting things into motion to stop the assassination.
description: Person of Interest Zero Day amazing scene
